data.name: ArgumentIsEmpty
data.value: The string argument '{argumentName}' cannot be empty.

data.name: CollectionArgumentIsEmpty
data.value: The collection argument '{argumentName}' must contain at least one element.

data.name: DatabaseErrorPageMiddleware_ContextNotRegistered
data.value: The context type '{0}' was not found in services. This usually means the context was not registered in services during startup. You probably want to call AddScoped<{0}>() inside the UseServices(...) call in your application startup code. Skipping display of the database error page.

data.name: DatabaseErrorPageMiddleware_Exception
data.value: An exception occurred while calculating the database error page content. Skipping display of the database error page.

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_AddMigrationCommand
data.value: > k ef migration add [migration name]

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_ApplyMigrationsButton
data.value: Apply Migrations

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_ApplyMigrationsButtonDone
data.value: Migrations Applied

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_ApplyMigrationsButtonRunning
data.value: Applying Migrations...

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_ApplyMigrationsFailed
data.value: An error occurred applying migrations, try applying them from the command line

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_HowToApplyFromCmd
data.value: You can also apply migrations from the command line:

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_MigrationsAppliedRefresh
data.value: Try refreshing the page

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_NoDbOrMigrationsInfo
data.value: From the command line, scaffold a new migration and apply it to the database:

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_NoDbOrMigrationsTitle
data.value: Use migrations to create the database for {0}

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_PendingChangesInfo
data.value: Scaffold a new migration for these changes and apply them to the database from the command line:

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_PendingChangesTitle
data.value: There are pending model changes for {0}

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_PendingMigrationsInfo
data.value: There are migrations for {0} that have not been applied to the database

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_PendingMigrationsTitle
data.value: Applying existing migrations for {0} may resolve this issue

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_ApplyMigrationsCommand
data.value: > k ef migration apply

data.name: InvalidEnumValue
data.value: The value provided for argument '{argumentName}' must be a valid value of enum type '{enumType}'.

data.name: MigrationsEndPointMiddleware_Applied
data.value: Migrations successfully applied for context '{0}'.

data.name: MigrationsEndPointMiddleware_ApplyingMigrations
data.value: Request is valid, applying migrations for context '{0}'.

data.name: MigrationsEndPointMiddleware_ContextNotRegistered
data.value: The context type '{0}' was not found in services. This usually means the context was not registered in services during startup. You probably want to call AddScoped<{0}>() inside the UseServices(...) call in your application startup code.

data.name: MigrationsEndPointMiddleware_Exception
data.value: An error occurred while applying the migrations for '{0}'. See InnerException for details.

data.name: MigrationsEndPointMiddleware_InvalidContextType
data.value: The context type '{0}' could not be loaded. Ensure this is the correct type name for the context you are trying to apply migrations for.

data.name: MigrationsEndPointMiddleware_NoContextType
data.value: No context type was specified. Ensure the form data from the request includes a contextTypeName value, specifying the context to apply migrations for.

data.name: MigrationsEndPointMiddleware_RequestPathMatched
data.value: Request path matched the path configured for this migrations endpoint ({0}). Attempting to process the migrations request.

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_Title
data.value: A database operation failed while processing the request.

data.name: DatabaseErrorPage_EnableMigrationsCommandsInfo
data.value: To use migrations from a command prompt you will need to install K Version Manager (KVM). Once installed, you can run migration commands from a standard command prompt in the project directory.
